title: Rear Suspension Unit - Disassembly

body.body: On the left rear suspension unit, remove the three fixings that attach the stone protector and remove the stone protector.
Wear eye and hand protection when you release or compress the spring on the rear suspension unit. The spring on the rear suspension unit is under pressure and if released suddenly can cause injury.
Compress the spring by hand until the spring seat is accessible.
Move the spring seat and spring under the collar of the lower mount so that the circlip is accessible.
Carefully remove and discard the circlip.
Align the spring seat with the collar on the lower mount.
Slowly release the tension from the spring and let the spring seat pass over the collar.
Noting their position and orientation, remove the lower spring, the circlip that attaches the inner spring guide, outer and inner spring guides, and the upper spring from the damper assembly.
Fully clean all dirt and contamination from all components.
Examine the inner and outer spring guides for excessive wear, scoring or damage. Replace the spring guides if necessary.
Examine the protective film label on the damper assembly. Replace the film label if necessary.
Examine all other components for wear or damage. Replace all worn or damaged components.

Always renew both rear suspension units as a pair, even if only one appears to be faulty. If only one suspension unit is replaced, the handling of the motorcycle could be adversely affected. This could result in an unsafe riding condition leading to a loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Examine the damper assembly for fluid leaks and replace the assembly if there are leaks.
